text: my name is Charlie McDowell and I'm the
director of the one I love so this is a
scene between our two main characters
Ethan and Sophie played by Mark Duplass
and Elizabeth moss and there there are a
couple who's struggling in their
marriage and they go to this retreat
house to kind of get away and really try
to work on things and the night before
this scene took place there was a big
kind of blowup fight and Ethan goes over
to this guest house and spends the night
alone that was a little bit of a weird
fight last night I know this is the kind
of first scene in the film where it's
the introduction into you know crossing
genres and and this is where there's a
kind of slightly sci-fi element that
comes into play a mystery element and
everything isn't what it seems and this
is where we start to feel that and and
start to piece it together as Ethan is
when he's talking to his wife who he
realizes has no recollection of the
fight that took place the night before
and so for me visually it was about
changing things from from what I had
shot earlier in in the main house and in
the guest house I use anamorphic lenses
which kind of gave it this warp II
something feels kind of off sci-fi feel
you can really see on the edges of the
frame you can see they're almost a
curving and it feels like something's
kind of surreal is happening and I also
use a lot of bright colors and and
really focused on everything feeling
super safe and comfortable even though
what's going on doesn't feel super safe
and comfortable for our main character
